TopicTitle: Resurrecting a dead mod - who to ask?

Articles.Content: So there is an old mod I have been playing around to see if I could make work in the new version.  The mod in question is P.E.W (Promethium Experimental Weaponry) by LORDPrometheus. However both him and SpannerMonkey seem to have gone absent. The mod in question is under a CC-BY-SA 2 license. Are there any extra steps I have to take if I wish to resurrect the mod?

On 9/6/2019 at 10:24 PM, HorizonFulcrum said:

So there is an old mod I have been playing around to see if I could make work in the new version.  The mod in question is P.E.W (Promethium Experimental Weaponry) by LORDPrometheus. However both him and SpannerMonkey seem to have gone absent. The mod in question is under a CC-BY-SA 2 license. Are there any extra steps I have to take if I wish to resurrect the mod?

Under that license you are free to fork it and continue as long as you keep to the license's details.  It is always polite to reach out to the former modders, however if they cannot be reached that is not a requirement.

On 9/9/2019 at 12:14 PM, goldenpsp said:

Under that license you are free to fork it and continue as long as you keep to the license's details.  It is always polite to reach out to the former modders, however if they cannot be reached that is not a requirement.

Thanks so much for the info!
